text.text: The Game Boy Color created in 1989 by Nintendo is the portable console succeeding the Game Boy. It incorporates a color screen barely larger than that of the Game Boy, but has an 8 Mhz processor, 32 KB of RAM, 16 KB of video memory and displays a resolution of 160x144 pixels in 56 colors. It is backwards compatible with all first generation Game Boy games and has 10 hours of battery life.
